definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: So don. t lose sight of your healthy diet pyramid when you do your shopping.
sentences.chinese: 所以你购物时要记起健康饮食金字塔。

sentences.english: On the top they built a temple of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 可知在金字塔上建庙目的是敬神。

sentences.english: I looked upon the Nile and raised the pyramids above it.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望尼罗河，在那上面建造金字塔。

sentences.english: So with sarcophagi and just like, different stones from the pyramids and statues.
sentences.chinese: 有石棺，还有金字塔和雕像上的各种石头。

sentences.english: Grains form the lowest level and the foundation of the pyramid.
sentences.chinese: 谷物是这个里面的最低层和金字塔的基础。

sentences.english: On the scale, compared to the mainland, it's more spectacular ancient Egyptian pyramid.
sentences.chinese: 论规模，它比大陆上的古埃及金字塔更为壮观。

sentences.english: Four hundred thousand men worked for twenty years to build it.
sentences.chinese: 四十万人花二十年时间才建成了这座金字塔。

sentences.english: Travel to meals of this work is the inverted pyramid concept.
sentences.chinese: 餐旅这项工作呈现的是倒金字塔型工作概念。

sentences.english: Quick, honey, take my picture. I got the pyramid in my hand.
sentences.chinese: 快，宝贝，照张相，我手托金字塔。

sentences.english: It is very much like an inverted pyramid, with me on the bottom and our customers at the top.
sentences.chinese: 如同倒金字塔一样，他们与我都在底部而客户在顶部。

sentences.english: It took a hundred thousand men more than twenty years to build the Great Pyramid.
sentences.chinese: 大金字塔是由十多万人修造了二十余年才建成的。

sentences.english: The Roman household was constructed like a pyramid.
sentences.chinese: 罗马家户类似金字塔结构。

sentences.english: The pyramid of Mexico are not as high as the pyramid mids of Egypt, but they are big.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥的金字塔没有埃及金字塔高，但是他们很大。

sentences.english: The pyramid of Mexico are not as high as the pyramid mids of Egypt, but they are big.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥的金字塔没有埃及金字塔高，但是他们很大。

sentences.english: The seventh layer of Mount Celestia can be reached only by climbing the ziggurat.
sentences.chinese: 要到达天堂山的第七层只能从金字塔神殿向上攀登。

sentences.english: Did slave labor give rise to the Great Pyramids of Giza?
sentences.chinese: 真的是奴隶建造了吉萨三大金字塔？

definition: top floor/the top of a building
flight of steps/(fig.) a means of advancement/stepping stone
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
